summary: WHILE PULLING OUT INTO TRAFFIC ON JULY 3, 2017, MOVING AT 30 MPH, THE ENGINE SUDDENLY LOST ALL POWER AND THE TRANSMISSION DOWNSHIFTED CAUSING THE CAR TO QUICKLY DECELERATE NEARLY CAUSING A REAR END COLLISION. THE ENGINE WARNING LIGHT INDICATED AN ENGINE FAULT REQUIRING IMMEDIATE SERVICE. THE ENGINE CONTINUED RUNNING BUT WITH HARDLY ANY ACCELERATION THEN LOSS OF POWER AND BUCKING. I PULLED TO SHOULDER AND WAS ABLE TO LIMP HOME ABOUT A MILE WITH ENGINE RUNNING ERRATICALLY ALL THE WAY. CALLED AAA AND HAD VEHICLE TOWED TO HAMMONASSET FORD IN MADISON CT FOR SERVICE ON JULY 4 2017. AWAITING RESPONSE FROM THEM AT THIS TIME.
